pages.title: Order-3-7 heptagonal honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-3-7 heptagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{7,3,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|7|node|3|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[heptagonal tiling|{7,3}]] [[File:Heptagonal tiling.svg|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-7 triangular tiling|{3,7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[7,3,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-3-7 heptagonal honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {7,3,7}. == Geometry== All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with seven heptagonal tilings existing around each edge and with an [[order-7 triangular tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 7-3-7 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_737_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs {''p'',3,''p''}: {{Symmetric2 tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-3-8 octagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-3-8 octagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{8,3,8}
{8,(3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|8|node|3|node|8|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|8|node|3|node|8|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|8|node|split1|branch|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[octagonal tiling|{8,3}]] [[File:H2 tiling 238-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-8 triangular tiling|{3,8}]] [[File:H2 tiling 238-4.png|40px]]
{(3,8,3)} [[File:H2 tiling 338-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[8,3,8]
[8,((3,4,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-3-8 octagonal honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {8,3,8}. It has eight [[octagonal tiling]]s, {8,3}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many octagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-8 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 8-3-8 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {8,(3,4,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|8|node|split1|branch|label4}}, with alternating types or colors of cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [8,3,8,1+] = [8,((3,4,3))]. {{-}} === Order-3-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-3-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{∞,3,∞}
{∞,(3,∞,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|3|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|3|node|infin|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[apeirogonal tiling|{∞,3}]] [[File:H2 tiling 23i-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:H2 tiling 23i-4.png|40px]] [[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,∞}]]
[[File:H2 tiling 33i-4.png|40px]] {(3,∞,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,3,∞]
[∞,((3,∞,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-3-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,3,∞}. It has infinitely many [[order-3 apeirogonal tiling]] {∞,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (Existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-3-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_i3i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,(3,∞,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of apeirogonal tiling cells. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Infinite-order dodecahedral honeycomb]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Heptagonal tilings]] [[Category:Infinite-order tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-3-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-7 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-3-7 hexagonal honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-3-7 hexagonal honeycomb |- !colspan=2|[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-3-7 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,3,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-7 triangular tiling|{3,8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 heptagonal tiling honeycomb|{7,3,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[6,3,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-3-7 hexagonal honeycomb''' or ('''6,3,7 honeycomb''') a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,3,7}. == Geometry== All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with seven hexagonal tilings existing around each edge and with an [[order-7 triangular tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |+ Ideal surface |- valign=top |[[File:H3 637 UHS plane at infinity view 1.png|240px]]
Rendered intersection of honeycomb with the ideal plane in [[Poincaré half-space model]] |[[File:H3 637 UHS plane at infinity view 2.png|240px]]
Closeup |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[hexagonal tiling]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]. {{hexagonal tiling cell tessellations}} === Order-3-8 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-3-8 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{6,3,8}
{6,(3,4,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|8|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|8|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-8 triangular tiling|{3,8}]] {(3,4,3)}
[[File:H2 tiling 238-4.png|40px]][[File:Uniform tiling 433-t2.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 octagonal tiling honeycomb|{8,3,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[6,3,8]
[6,((3,4,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-3-8 hexagonal honeycomb''' or ('''6,3,8 honeycomb''') is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,3,8}. It has eight [[hexagonal tiling]]s, {6,3}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-8 triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-3-8 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,(3,4,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|label4}}, with alternating types or colors of tetrahedral cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [6,3,8,1+] = [6,((3,4,3))]. {{-}} === Order-infinite-3 hexagonal honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-infinite-3 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{6,3,∞}
{6,(3,∞,3)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|3|node|infin|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node_g|3sg|node_g|infin|node}} ↔ [[File:CDD_6-3star-infin.png]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 63-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order triangular tiling|{3,∞}]], {(3,∞,3)}
[[File:H2 tiling 23i-4.png|60px]][[File:H2 tiling 33i-4.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 apeirogonal tiling honeycomb|{∞,3,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[6,3,∞]
[6,((3,∞,3))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-infinite-3 hexagonal honeycomb''' or ('''6,3,∞ honeycomb''') is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,3,∞}. It has infinitely many [[hexagonal tiling]] {6,3} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (Existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order triangular tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-3-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_63i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,(3,∞,3)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of hexagonal tiling cells. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Infinite-order dodecahedral honeycomb]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Hexagonal tilings]] [[Category:Infinite-order tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-3-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-7 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-4-3 pentagonal honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-3 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|4|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-4 pentagonal tiling|{5,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 54-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Cube|{4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 octahedral honeycomb|{3,4,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[5,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-3 pentagonal honeycomb''' or '''5,4,3 honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell is an [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. == Geometry== The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-4-3 pentagonal honeycomb'' is {5,4,3}, with three order-4 pentagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a cube, {4,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-4-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_543_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is a part of a series of regular polytopes and honeycombs with {''p'',4,3} [[Schläfli symbol]], and tetrahedral [[vertex figures]]: {{-}} === Order-4-3 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-3 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octagonal tiling|{6,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 64-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Cube|{4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 octahedral honeycomb|{3,4,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[6,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-3 hexagonal honeycomb''' or '''6,4,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-4 hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-4-3 hexagonal honeycomb'' is {6,4,3}, with three ''order-4 hexagonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a cube, {4,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-4-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_643_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-4-3 heptagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-3 heptagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{7,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|7|node|4|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-4 heptagonal tiling|{7,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 74-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Cube|{4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-7 octahedral honeycomb|{3,4,7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[7,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-3 heptagonal honeycomb''' or '''7,4,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[order-4 heptagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-4-3 heptagonal honeycomb'' is {7,4,3}, with three ''order-4 heptagonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a cube, {4,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 7-4-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_743_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-4-3 octagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-3 octagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{8,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|8|node|4|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-4 octagonal tiling|{8,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 84-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Cube|{4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-8 octahedral honeycomb|{3,4,8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[8,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-3 octagonal honeycomb''' or '''8,4,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[order-4 octagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-4-3 octagonal honeycomb'' is {8,4,3}, with three ''order-4 octagonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a cube, {4,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 8-4-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |} {{-}} === Order-4-3 apeirogonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-3 apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{∞,4,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|4|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-3 apeirogonal tiling|{∞,4}]] [[File:H2_tiling_24i-1.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon]] {∞} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[cube|{4,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Infinite-order octahedral honeycomb|{3,4,∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[∞,4,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-3 apeirogonal honeycomb''' or '''∞,4,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[apeirogonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the apeirogonal tiling honeycomb is {∞,4,3}, with three apeirogonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a cube, {4,3}. The "ideal surface" projection below is a plane-at-infinity, in the Poincaré half-space model of H3. It shows a [[Apollonian gasket]] pattern of circles inside a largest circle. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-4-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_i43_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Pentagonal tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-4-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-3 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-4 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,4,4}
{5,41,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|5|node|split1-44|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-4 pentagonal tiling|{5,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 54-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Square tiling|{4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-5 square honeycomb|{4,4,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[5,4,4]
[5,41,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-4 pentagonal honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[pentagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. == Geometry== The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-4-4 pentagonal honeycomb'' is {5,4,4}, with four order-4 pentagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a square tiling, {4,4}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-4-4 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_544_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is a part of a series of regular polytopes and honeycombs with {p,4,4} [[Schläfli symbol]], and tetrahedral [[vertex figures]]: {{Square tiling vertex figure tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-4-4 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-4 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,4,4}
{6,41,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1-44|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Octagonal tiling|{6,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 64-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Square tiling|{4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-6 square honeycomb|{4,4,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[6,4,4]
[6,41,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-4 hexagonal honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-4 hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the octagonal tiling honeycomb is {6,4,4}, with three octagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a square tiling, {4,4}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-4-4 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_644_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-4-4 apeirogonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-4 apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{∞,4,4}
{∞,41,1} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|4|node|4|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1-44|nodes}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-3 apeirogonal tiling|{∞,4}]] [[File:H2_tiling_24i-1.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[square tiling|{4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-infinite square honeycomb|{4,4,∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[∞,4,4]
[∞,41,1] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-4 apeirogonal honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-4 apeirogonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the apeirogonal tiling honeycomb is {∞,4,4}, with three order-4 apeirogonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a square tiling, {4,4}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-4-4 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_i44_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]

pages.title: Order-4-5 pentagonal honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-5 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,4,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|4|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[pentagonal tiling|{5,4}]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 square tiling|{4,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[5,4,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-5 pentagonal honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,4,5}. == Geometry== All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with five order-4 pentagonal tilings existing around each edge and with an [[order-5 square tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-4-5 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_545_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs {''p'',4,''p''}: {{Symmetric3 tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-4-6 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-6 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{6,4,6}
{6,(4,3,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|4|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|label4}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[order-4 hexagonal tiling|{6,4}]] [[File:H2 tiling 246-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 square tiling|{4,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 246-4.png|40px]]
{(4,3,4)} [[File:H2 tiling 344-1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[6,4,6]
[6,((4,3,4))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-6 hexagonal honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,3,6}. It has six [[order-4 hexagonal tiling]]s, {6,4}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-4-6 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_646_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,(4,3,4)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1|branch|label4}}, with alternating types or colors of cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [6,4,6,1+] = [6,((4,3,4))]. {{-}} === Order-4-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{∞,4,∞}
{∞,(4,∞,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|4|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|4|node|infin|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[apeirogonal tiling|{∞,4}]] [[File:H2 tiling 24i-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:H2 tiling 24i-4.png|40px]] [[Infinite-order square tiling|{4,∞}]]
[[File:H2 tiling 44i-4.png|40px]] {(4,∞,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,4,∞]
[∞,((4,∞,4))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,4,∞}. It has infinitely many [[order-4 apeirogonal tiling]] {∞,4} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-4-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_i4i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,(4,∞,4)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of cells. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Infinite-order dodecahedral honeycomb]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {5,4,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {5,4,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Pentagonal tilings]] [[Category:Infinite-order tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-4-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-5 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-4-5 square honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-5 square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,4,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]s||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Square tiling|{4,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 44-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 square tiling|{4,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-4.png|50px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-4 pentagonal honeycomb|{5,4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,4,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-5 square honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,4,5}. It has five [[square tiling]] {4,4} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many square tiling existing around each vertex in an [[order-5 square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. == Images== {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-4-5 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_445_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs with [[octahedron|square tiling]] [[cell (geometry)|cells]]: {4,4,''p''} {{square tiling tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-4-6 square honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-6 square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,4,6}
{4,(4,3,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[square tiling|{4,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 44-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 square tiling|{4,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 246-4.png|40px]]
{(4,3,4)} [[File:Uniform tiling 443-t1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[order-4-4 hexagonal honeycomb|{6,4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,4,6]
[4,((4,3,4))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-6 square honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,4,6}. It has six [[square tiling]], {4,4}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many square tiling existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-4-6 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_446_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,(4,3,4)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|branch}}, with alternating types or colors of square tiling cells. In [[Coxeter notation]] the half symmetry is [4,4,6,1+] = [4,((4,3,4))]. {{-}} ===Order-4-infinite square honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-infinite square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{4,4,∞}
{4,(4,∞,4)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Square tiling|{4,4}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 44-t0.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Infinite-order square tiling|{4,∞}]] [[File:H2 tiling 24i-4.png|40px]]
{(4,∞,4)} [[File:H2 tiling 44i-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-4-4 apeirogonal honeycomb|{∞,4,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,4,3]
[4,((4,∞,4))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-4-infinite square honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,4,∞}. It has infinitely many [[square tiling]], {4,4}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many square tiling existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable width=480 |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-4-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_44i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,(4,∞,4)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|4|node|4|node|infin|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|4|node|split1-44|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of square tiling cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [4,4,∞,1+] = [4,((4,∞,4))]. == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-4-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-5 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-5-3 square honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{4,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-5 square tiling|{4,5}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 45-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[Dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 octahedral honeycomb|{3,5,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[4,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 square honeycomb''' or '''4,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[pentagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. == Geometry== The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-5-3 square honeycomb'' is {4,5,3}, with three order-4 pentagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_453_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is a part of a series of regular polytopes and honeycombs with {''p'',5,3} [[Schläfli symbol]], and dodecahedral [[vertex figures]]: {{-}} === Order-5-3 pentagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-5 pentagonal tiling|{5,5}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 55-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-5 icosahedral honeycomb|{3,5,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[5,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 pentagonal honeycomb''' or '''5,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-5 pentagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-5-3 pentagonal honeycomb'' is {5,5,3}, with three ''order-5 pentagonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_553_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} === Order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-5 hexagonal tiling|{6,5}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 65-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 icosahedral honeycomb|{3,5,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[6,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb''' or '''6,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-5 hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb'' is {6,5,3}, with three order-5 hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_653_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-5-3 heptagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 heptagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{7,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|7|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-5 heptagonal tiling|{7,5}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 75-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Heptagon|{7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-7 icosahedral honeycomb|{3,5,7}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[7,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 heptagonal honeycomb''' or '''7,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-5 heptagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-5-3 heptagonal honeycomb'' is {7,5,3}, with three order-5 heptagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 7-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_753_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-5-3 octagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 octagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{8,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|8|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-5 octagonal tiling|{8,5}]] [[File:Uniform tiling 85-t0.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Octagon|{8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-8 icosahedral honeycomb|{3,5,8}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[8,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 octagonal honeycomb''' or '''8,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-5 octagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-5-3 octagonal honeycomb'' is {8,5,3}, with three order-5 octagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 8-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |} {{-}} === Order-5-3 apeirogonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{∞,5,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|5|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-3 apeirogonal tiling|{∞,5}]] [[File:H2_tiling_25i-1.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon]] {∞} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[dodecahedron|{5,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Infinite-order octahedral honeycomb|{3,5,∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[∞,5,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-3 apeirogonal honeycomb''' or '''∞,5,3 honeycomb''' a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-5 apeirogonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the apeirogonal tiling honeycomb is {∞,5,3}, with three ''order-5 apeirogonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a dodecahedron, {5,3}. The "ideal surface" projection below is a plane-at-infinity, in the Poincaré half-space model of H3. It shows a [[Apollonian gasket]] pattern of circles inside a largest circle. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-5-3 poincare vc.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]]
(Vertex centered) |[[File:H3_i53_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Square tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-5-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-3 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-5-4 square honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-4-5 square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{4,5,4} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|5|node|4|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[order-5 square tiling|{4,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 245-4.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-4 pentagonal tiling|{5,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[4,5,4] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-4 square honeycomb''' (or '''4,5,4 honeycomb''') a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {4,5,4}. == Geometry== All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with four [[order-5 square tiling]]s existing around each edge and with an [[order-4 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-5-4 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_454_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It a part of a sequence of [[regular polychora]] and honeycombs {''p'',5,''p''}: {{Symmetric4 tessellations}} {{-}} === Order-5-5 pentagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-5 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,5,5} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|5|node|5|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[pentagonal tiling|{5,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 255-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-5 pentagonal tiling|{5,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[5,5,5] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-5 pentagonal honeycomb''' (or '''5,5,5 honeycomb''') a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {5,5,5}. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with five order-5 pentagonal tilings existing around each edge and with an [[order-5 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex figure]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-5-5 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_555_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-5-6 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-6 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{6,5,6}
{6,(5,3,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|5|node|6|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|6|node|5|node|6|node_h0}} = {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1-55|branch}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[order-5 hexagonal tiling|{6,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 256-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-6 pentagonal tiling|{5,6}]] [[File:H2 tiling 256-4.png|40px]]
{(5,3,5)} [[File:H2 tiling 355-1.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[6,5,6]
[6,((5,3,5))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-6 hexagonal honeycomb''' (or '''6,5,6 honeycomb''') is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,5,6}. It has six [[order-4 hexagonal tiling]]s, {6,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many hexagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-6 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-5-6 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_656_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {6,(5,3,5)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|6|node|split1-55|branch}}, with alternating types or colors of cells. In Coxeter notation the half symmetry is [6,5,6,1+] = [6,((5,3,5))]. {{-}} === Order-5-7 heptagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=280 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-7 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{7,5,7} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|7|node|5|node|7|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[order-5 heptagonal tiling|{7,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 257-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[Order-7 pentagonal tiling|{5,7}]] [[File:H2 tiling 257-4.png|40px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[7,5,7] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-7 heptagonal honeycomb''' (or '''7,5,7 honeycomb''') is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {7,5,7}. It has six [[order-4 heptagonal tiling]]s, {7,5}, around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many heptagonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[order-7 pentagonal tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:H3_757_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-5-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb === {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" width=240 !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]s||{∞,5,∞}
{∞,(5,∞,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter diagrams]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|5|node|infin|node}}
{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|5|node|infin|node_h0}} ↔ {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1-55|branch|labelinfin}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[apeirogonal tiling|{∞,5}]] [[File:H2 tiling 25i-1.png|60px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edge figure||[[Apeirogon|{∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertex figure||[[File:H2 tiling 25i-4.png|40px]] [[Infinite-order square tiling|{5,∞}]]
[[File:H2 tiling 55i-4.png|40px]] {(5,∞,5)} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||self-dual |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter-Dynkin diagram#Lorentzian groups|Coxeter group]]||[∞,5,∞]
[∞,((5,∞,5))] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-5-infinite apeirogonal honeycomb''' (or '''∞,5,∞ honeycomb''') is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]) with [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,5,∞}. It has infinitely many [[order-5 apeirogonal tiling]] {∞,5} around each edge. All vertices are ultra-ideal (existing beyond the ideal boundary) with infinitely many order-5 apeirogonal tilings existing around each vertex in an [[infinite-order square tiling]] [[vertex arrangement]]. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-5-i poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_i5i_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} It has a second construction as a uniform honeycomb, [[Schläfli symbol]] {∞,(5,∞,5)}, Coxeter diagram, {{CDD|node_1|infin|node|split1-55|branch|labelinfin}}, with alternating types or colors of cells. {{-}} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] * [[Infinite-order dodecahedral honeycomb]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Infinite-order tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-5-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-4 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]

pages.title: Order-6-3 square honeycomb
pages.text:
{| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-3 square honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{4,6,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|4|node|6|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-6 square tiling|{4,6}]] [[File:H2_tiling_246-4.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Square|{4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 octahedral honeycomb|{3,6,4}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[4,6,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-3 square honeycomb''' or '''4,6,3 honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of a [[hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. == Geometry== The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-6-3 square honeycomb'' is {4,6,3}, with three order-4 hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a hexagonal tiling, {6,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 4-6-3 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_463_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == Related polytopes and honeycombs == It is a part of a series of regular polytopes and honeycombs with {''p'',6,3} [[Schläfli symbol]], and dodecahedral [[vertex figures]]: {{-}} === Order-6-3 pentagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-3 pentagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{5,6,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|5|node|6|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-6 pentagonal tiling|{5,6}]] [[File:H2_tiling_256-4.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Pentagon|{5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6 icosahedral honeycomb|{3,6,5}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[5,6,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-3 pentagonal honeycomb''' or '''5,6,3 honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-6 pentagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-6-3 pentagonal honeycomb'' is {5,6,3}, with three ''order-6 pentagonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a hexagonal tiling, {6,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 5-6-3 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_563_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} === Order-6-3 hexagonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-5-3 hexagonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{6,6,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|6|node|6|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-6 hexagonal tiling|{6,6}]] [[File:H2_tiling_266-4.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Hexagon|{6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-6 triangular honeycomb|{3,6,6}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[6,6,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-3 hexagonal honeycomb''' or '''6,6,3 honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-6 hexagonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the ''order-6-3 hexagonal honeycomb'' is {6,6,3}, with three order-5 hexagonal tilings meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a hexagonal tiling, {6,3}. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb 6-6-3 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_663_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} {{-}} === Order-6-3 apeirogonal honeycomb=== {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin-left:10px" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Order-6-3 apeirogonal honeycomb |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||[[List of regular polytopes#Tessellations of hyperbolic 3-space|Regular honeycomb]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Schläfli symbol]]||{∞,6,3} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter diagram]]||{{CDD|node_1|infin|node|6|node|3|node}} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Cells||[[Order-3 apeirogonal tiling|{∞,6}]] [[File:H2_tiling_26i-1.png|80px]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||[[Apeirogon]] {∞} |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Vertex figure]]||[[hexagonal tiling|{6,3}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Dual||[[Order-6-infinite triangular honeycomb|{3,6,∞}]] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|[[Coxeter–Dynkin diagram#Ranks 4.E2.80.9310|Coxeter group]]||[∞,6,3] |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Properties||Regular |} In the [[geometry]] of [[Hyperbolic space|hyperbolic 3-space]], the '''order-6-3 apeirogonal honeycomb''' or '''∞,6,3 honeycomb''' is a regular space-filling [[tessellation]] (or [[honeycomb (geometry)|honeycomb]]). Each infinite cell consists of an [[order-6 apeirogonal tiling]] whose vertices lie on a [[Hypercycle (geometry)|2-hypercycle]], each of which has a limiting circle on the ideal sphere. The [[Schläfli symbol]] of the apeirogonal tiling honeycomb is {∞,6,3}, with three ''order-6 apeirogonal tilings'' meeting at each edge. The [[vertex figure]] of this honeycomb is a hexagonal tiling, {6,3}. The "ideal surface" projection below is a plane-at-infinity, in the Poincaré half-space model of H3. It shows a [[Apollonian gasket]] pattern of circles inside a largest circle. {| class=wikitable |[[File:Hyperbolic honeycomb i-6-3 poincare.png|240px]]
[[Poincaré disk model]] |[[File:H3_i63_UHS_plane_at_infinity.png|240px]]
Ideal surface |} == See also == * [[Convex uniform honeycombs in hyperbolic space]] * [[List of regular polytopes]] == References == {{reflist}} *[[H. S. M. Coxeter|Coxeter]], ''[[Regular Polytopes (book)|Regular Polytopes]]'', 3rd. ed., Dover Publications, 1973. {{ISBN|0-486-61480-8}}. (Tables I and II: Regular polytopes and honeycombs, pp. 294–296) * ''The Beauty of Geometry: Twelve Essays'' (1999), Dover Publications, {{LCCN|99035678}}, {{ISBN|0-486-40919-8}} (Chapter 10, [http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1954.3/Main/icm1954.3.0155.0169.ocr.pdf Regular Honeycombs in Hyperbolic Space]) Table III * [[Jeffrey Weeks (mathematician)|Jeffrey R. Weeks]] ''The Shape of Space, 2nd edition'' {{ISBN|0-8247-0709-5}} (Chapters 16–17: Geometries on Three-manifolds I,II) * George Maxwell, ''Sphere Packings and Hyperbolic Reflection Groups'', JOURNAL OF ALGEBRA 79,78-97 (1982) [http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0021869382903180] * Hao Chen, Jean-Philippe Labbé, ''Lorentzian Coxeter groups and Boyd-Maxwell ball packings'', (2013)[https://arxiv.org/abs/1310.8608] * [https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.02851 Visualizing Hyperbolic Honeycombs arXiv:1511.02851] Roice Nelson, Henry Segerman (2015) == External links == *[[John Baez]], ''Visual insights'': [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/01/733-honeycomb/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb] (2014/08/01) [http://blogs.ams.org/visualinsight/2014/08/14/733-honeycomb-meets-plane-at-infinity/ {7,3,3} Honeycomb Meets Plane at Infinity] (2014/08/14) * [[Danny Calegari]], [http://lamington.wordpress.com/2014/03/04/kleinian-a-tool-for-visualizing-kleinian-groups/Kleinian Kleinian, a tool for visualizing Kleinian groups, Geometry and the Imagination] 4 March 2014. [http://math.uchicago.edu/~dannyc/papers/kleinian_mtf_Feb_2014.pdf] [[Category:Honeycombs (geometry)]] [[Category:Square tilings]] [[Category:Isogonal 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Isochoric 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-6-n 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Order-n-3 3-honeycombs]] [[Category:Regular 3-honeycombs]]
